intro: Callicore rosea, commonly known as the pink mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are hairy, typical of the mallow family. Callicore rosea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to xeriscaped gardens.
